MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | d: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | b: Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What was the earliest machine learning model introduced by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s?
Choices: a: Program for calculating winning chance in checkers | c: Program for recognizing speech patterns | b: Program for analyzing sonar signals | d: Program for classifying data based on models

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks for machine learning algorithms?
Choices: d: Donald Hebb | c: Raytheon Company | a: Tom M. Mitchell | b: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the purpose of the experimental 'learning machine' Cybertron developed by Raytheon Company in the 1960s?
Choices: a: To analyze stock market data | d: To play computer games | b: To recognize patterns in sonar signals | c: To predict future outcomes in healthcare

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, when is a computer program said to learn from experience?
Choices: d: When it is repetitively 'trained' by a human operator | c: When it is equipped with a 'goof' button | a: When its performance at tasks in T improves with experience E | b: When it is trained to recognize patterns
